page.title: 01Berks.Downs & Farnborough.
page.content: This area is wholly agricultural with only isolated dwellings amongst the fields and woods. Farnborough is the only village and this is very small consisting of about 29 houses with 59 adults and 16 children. The parish as a whole has only 85 inhabitants in total. The land is used for a variety of crops including wheat,barley,oats and some root crops such as swedes and turnips. The cattle are mainly for Dairy but some are kept for beef. There are many sheep on the Downs as this is traditional in the region. There are several Drove roads in the area. Gallops are another feature of as this is one of the main race horse training areas. Wildlife is abundant. Woodland is both Coniferous Deciduous and mixed.
